description: This is a trail on the dykes buit up by the acadians a long time ago.  The dykes are located in a national wildlife area known for its diverse bird species.  The trail is flat and goes through mostly a stand of birch trees growing on the dyke.
directions: Highway 6 to Wallace.  turn on Aboiteau Rd and then park at the entrance of the trail at  45°49'42.56"N,  63°34'1.21"W
title: Wallace Bay Wilderness Area
